bug.author: NickleDave
bug.description:
Thank you for submitting a TensorFlow documentation issue. Per our GitHub policy, we only address code/doc bugs, performance issues, feature requests, and build/installation issues on GitHub. The TensorFlow docs are open source! To get involved, read the documentation contributor guide: <denchmark-link:https://www.tensorflow.org/community/contribute/docs>https://www.tensorflow.org/community/contribute/docs</denchmark-link>
<denchmark-h:h2>URL(s) with the issue:</denchmark-h>
#<denchmark-link:https://www.tensorflow.org/alpha/guide/data#applying_arbitrary_python_logic>https://www.tensorflow.org/alpha/guide/data#applying_arbitrary_python_logic</denchmark-link>
<denchmark-link:https://www.tensorflow.org/beta/guide/data#applying_arbitrary_python_logic>https://www.tensorflow.org/beta/guide/data#applying_arbitrary_python_logic</denchmark-link>
<denchmark-h:h2>Description of issue (what needs changing):</denchmark-h>
minor typo, just need to update py_func in example so it is py_function <denchmark-h:h3>Clear description</denchmark-h>
In last 4 lines of code block underneath "applying arbitrary python logic" section dataset = dataset.map( lambda filename, label: tuple(tf.py_func( _read_py_function, [filename, label], [tf.uint8, label.dtype]))) dataset = dataset.map(_resize_function) <denchmark-h:h3>Correct links</denchmark-h>
Yes <denchmark-h:h3>Parameters defined</denchmark-h>
Yes <denchmark-h:h3>Returns defined</denchmark-h>
Yes <denchmark-h:h3>Raises listed and defined</denchmark-h>
Yes <denchmark-h:h3>Usage example</denchmark-h>
Yes <denchmark-h:h3>Request visuals, if applicable</denchmark-h>
No, not needed <denchmark-h:h3>Submit a pull request?</denchmark-h>
No

comments.comment: Thanks for the report, David. That file is over here, would you mind making the fix and then I can merge it: <denchmark-link:https://github.com/tensorflow/docs/blob/master/site/en/r2/guide/data.md>https://github.com/tensorflow/docs/blob/master/site/en/r2/guide/data.md</denchmark-link>
Closing this issue since the PR <denchmark-link:https://github.com/tensorflow/docs/pull/697>tensorflow/docs#697</denchmark-link> has been merged. Thanks!
